page.title: 20 LANDSCAPES AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Only the top North West corner of our block covers parks of Cannock Chase. This section of the Chase is known as Shoal Hill which is dominated by deciduous trees. However,the Chase is one of Britain's major beauty spots & in 1958 Cannock Chase was designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty by the Countryside Commission. This recognised the rich variety of scenery on the Chase,from wild heathlands to secluded valleys. There are many red deer on the Chase and in medieval times the doe came to Calving Hill now the site of Sherbrook school,to give birth to her young. There are 45 listed buildings within the district. None are of exceptional merit (grade 1) but they are of special interest (grade 2) and should be preserved eg the former Council House.
